mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Built for František Josef Herbst as a department store. Gocar was required to blend the building with the Baroque architecture of Old Town.Functioned originally as a department store with a cafe on the first floor and apartments above the store. The building was converted into offices. It was restored in 2002-2003 and today houses the Museum of Czech Cubism. The cafe, Grand Cafe Orient, was reopened. [work]
